<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/04/toyota-ends-gm-s-90-year-run-as-the-top-automaker-in-the-us?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Toyota Says, 'More Like Lieutenant Motors'
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/04/toyota-ends-gm-s-90-year-run-as-the-top-automaker-in-the-us?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Toyota logo with a checkered flag and a No. 1 foam finger in the background " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/d7bd2c033bd4ce8eb7638a2577187b13b06f8288-1500x1000.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Dianna “Mick” McDougall</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Detroit-based General Motors has been the top-selling automaker in the US in every single year since 1931. But even Cadillacs lose their shine after a while.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Japan’s Toyota <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/04/toyota-dethrones-gm-to-become-americas-top-selling-automaker-in-2021.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dethroned GM</a> as the No. 1 automaker in the country in 2021, marking the first time on record that a foreign car manufacturer has topped the list.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Run the numbers:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Japan sold 2.3 million vehicles in 2021, up 10% from the year before.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>GM sold 2.2 million, down 13% from 2021.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened: </strong>All automakers have had to navigate that nasty chip shortage during the pandemic, but Toyota managed to do it better than GM thanks to a bigger stockpile of chips it had set aside.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And even if GM recaptures the title next year, 2021’s results still show that the US auto winds have forever shifted. “The dominance of the US automakers of the US market is just over,” University of Michigan biz professor Erik Gordon </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/04/business/toyota-car-sales-2021.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the NYT</a></span><span>.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">No car manufacturer suffered from a lack of demand in 2021—limited production capacity is primarily to blame for the bottleneck. Average new vehicle prices surged 20% last month to a record $45,700 according to J.D. Power, which reflects ravenous consumer appetite for cars paired with a supply crunch.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Speaking of strong demand…</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ford’s electric F-150 Lightning pickup truck is selling like hotcakes. The company, which itself was leapfrogged by GM in 1931 as the US’ top automaker, is <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2022/01/04/ford-double-production-lightning-pickup/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">doubling production capacity</a> for the vehicle thanks to “huge demand,” according to CEO Jim Farley. It’s the second time the company has raised its production target for the pickup truck.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Sales of the electric F-150 are considered the bellwether for interest in electric vehicles in the US, considering the F-Series has been the top-selling vehicle in the country for decades.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ford stock popped another 11.7% yesterday, continuing its fantastic run of form. The company’s 137.5% gain in 2021 was among the best in the S&P 500, and its share price is now at its highest level in 20 years.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/I-95-gridlocked-hours-virginia?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Stranded Drivers Had the Worst Snow Day Ever
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/I-95-gridlocked-hours-virginia?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="A screenshot of the I-95 traffic on Google Maps" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/0ff3c3d8ceb7347ee3757ebd3c9fb6ffd6406e4b-1084x858.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Google Maps</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hundreds of motorists were stuck in their cars for nearly 30 hours Monday night into Tuesday, after truck crashes during a snowstorm brought over 40 miles of I-95 in Virginia to a standstill.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Drivers posted on social media about <a href="https://www.nbcwashington.com/news/local/transportation/never-seen-anything-like-it-drivers-stranded-for-15-hours-on-i-95-in-virginia/2926464/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">running out</a> of food, water, and gas; having to trek into the storm to relieve themselves; and worrying about passengers with medical needs. As of yesterday afternoon, the Virginia State Police hadn’t reported any deaths or injuries tied to the gridlock.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Where was the help?</strong> State troopers went car-to-car to provide supplies, ambulances sheltered some children in need of warmth, and tow trucks hauled vehicles out of the snow and ice. Meanwhile, truck drivers and other good Samaritans shared extra supplies. But it’s been a slow fix—way too slow for many. Virginia's governor rebuffed calls to deploy the national guard, saying that it wasn't required.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Virginia Department of Transportation told the NYT they expected to clear the interstate of stuck vehicles by end-of-day Tuesday. Virginia Senator Tim Kaine, for one, <a href="https://twitter.com/timkaine/status/1478476547552169987?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a> that he made it into Washington, DC, a mere 27 hours after he started his normally 2-hour trip from Richmond.—<em>JW</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/quarantined-Chinese-citizens-barter-food-supplies-shortages?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Speaking of Being Stranded…
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/quarantined-Chinese-citizens-barter-food-supplies-shortages?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="A worker delivers food in Xi'an" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/5c28e991d673496a3ac7a8d107729f599d62ee59-5184x3456.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>VCG via Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nearly all of the 13 million residents in the Chinese city of Xi’an have <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-59864266?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">been quarantined</a> in their homes since late December—and some have resorted to bartering due to shortages of food and supplies. A peek at how dire the situation is: One video circulating on Chinese social media shows a resident trading a Nintendo Switch for a packet of noodles and two buns.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How did Xi’an get here?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In late December, Xi’an households were forced to quarantine, but one family member was permitted to go on a grocery run every two days. The rules have since tightened: Now, residents must rely on government workers to provide daily necessities but have flocked to social media to complain they’re not getting enough.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Unlike most other governments, China has followed a “zero Covid” strategy since the pandemic began, an approach in which it cuts off movement to and from any area that reports even a single case (think Wuhan in winter 2020). Xi’an has reported over 1,600 cases in the last two weeks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Monday, a second large Chinese city, Yuzhou, was locked down after three cases were reported.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> China is frantically trying to contain Covid-19 ahead of the Beijing Winter Olympics and Lunar New Year; both are happening next month.—<em>JW</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/04/key-performance-indicators-january-5?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">

Key Performance Indicators

</h1>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/04/key-performance-indicators-january-5?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Shoes are placed at Ryerson Univerisity to mourn 215 indigenous children whose remains were discovered at a former residential school" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/fa1446e4c911c760c5aaba4f0e37a8d712918214-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Yu Ruidong/China News Service via Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Canada reached a <a href="https://thehill.com/policy/international/588212-canada-agrees-to-315b-settlement-over-treatment-of-indigenous-children?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$31.5 billion deal</a> to reform the country’s discriminatory child welfare system and compensate Indigenous children who were removed from their families and put into the system. It’s the largest settlement in Canadian history, according to the government.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“The last time agriculture was on the precipice of this much change was when we were on the cusp of replacing the horse and plow.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">John Deere CTO Jahmy Hindman spoke to Axios about the company’s <a href="https://www.axios.com/deeres-driverless-tractor-gives-stressed-farmers-a-new-tool-8309937e-cf13-4edf-837a-ac81c256495d.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new 8R tractor</a>. What’s so revolutionary about it? The 8R is the world’s first autonomous tractor, and it’ll be available for sale later this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>What money could look like in the metaverse. (<a href="https://www.newyorker.com/news/letter-from-silicon-valley/money-in-the-metaverse?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The New Yorker</a>)</p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
NFTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/NFT-Bored-Ape-Yacht-Club-pass-1-billion-sales?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
All My Apes Bored and Rich
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/NFT-Bored-Ape-Yacht-Club-pass-1-billion-sales?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Eminem's Bored Ape Yacht Club NFT" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/23b64ed21de07fa05c9e69d94291858d6ef4549c-1240x744.webp?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Bored Ape Yacht Club</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Bored Ape Yacht Club (BAYC), a collection of 10,000 ape avatars that individually act as tickets to an online social club, has become one of the most prominent brands in the NFT space. And now, the NFTs have generated more than <a href="https://www.theblockcrypto.com/linked/129084/bored-ape-yacht-club-crosses-1-billion-in-total-sales?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$1 billion in total sales</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You’ve likely seen a Bored Ape—like the botched restoration of the Jesus Christ fresco, they’re somewhat…unforgettable to look at. They’re also highly sought after: Eminem bought one for ~$462,000 on Dec. 31, joining the ranks of other celebrity buyers like Jimmy Fallon and Steph Curry.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But if you’re as bored of looking at the apes as they are of existing, you aren’t alone. Critics have called the BAYC project cynical, accusing it of being more about showcasing wealth than art. The current minimum cost for a BAYC NFT is about 70 ether, or around $266,000.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And then there’s the crime aspect: </strong>The NFT space has faced ridicule for its security issues, and the BAYC has had some notable recent thefts. One collector fell prey to a phishing scam and lost his collection, including many BAYC NFTs, worth $2.28 million. In a now-iconic tweet, he wrote, “I been hacked. All my apes gone.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">OpenSea, the largest NFT marketplace, has reportedly “frozen” the stolen NFTs, raising even more questions from the crypto community about how a decentralized platform can freeze assets in the first place.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

10% from the year before.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGM sold 2.2 million, down 13% from 2021.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened: \u003c/strong\u003eAll automakers have had to navigate that nasty chip shortage during the pandemic, but Toyota managed to do it better than GM thanks to a bigger stockpile of chips it had set aside.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd even if GM recaptures the title next year, 2021’s results still show that the US auto winds have forever shifted. “The dominance of the US automakers of the US market is just over,” University of Michigan biz professor Erik Gordon \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/04/business/toyota-car-sales-2021.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the NYT\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNo car manufacturer suffered from a lack of demand in 2021—limited production capacity is primarily to blame for the bottleneck. Average new vehicle prices surged 20% last month to a record $45,700 according to J.D. Power, which reflects ravenous consumer appetite for cars paired with a supply crunch.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSpeaking of strong demand…\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFord’s electric F-150 Lightning pickup truck is selling like hotcakes. The company, which itself was leapfrogged by GM in 1931 as the US’ top automaker, is \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2022/01/04/ford-double-production-lightning-pickup/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edoubling production capacity\u003c/a\u003e for the vehicle thanks to “huge demand,” according to CEO Jim Farley. It’s the second time the company has raised its production target for the pickup truck.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eSales of the electric F-150 are considered the bellwether for interest in electric vehicles in the US, considering the F-Series has been the top-selling vehicle in the country for decades.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFord stock popped another 11.7% yesterday, continuing its fantastic run of form. The company’s 137.5% gain in 2021 was among the best in the S\u0026P 500, and its share price is now at its highest level in 20 years.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHundreds of motorists were stuck in their cars for nearly 30 hours Monday night into Tuesday, after truck crashes during a snowstorm brought over 40 miles of I-95 in Virginia to a standstill.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDrivers posted on social media about \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcwashington.com/news/local/transportation/never-seen-anything-like-it-drivers-stranded-for-15-hours-on-i-95-in-virginia/2926464/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erunning out\u003c/a\u003e of food, water, and gas; having to trek into the storm to relieve themselves; and worrying about passengers with medical needs. As of yesterday afternoon, the Virginia State Police hadn’t reported any deaths or injuries tied to the gridlock.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhere was the help?\u003c/strong\u003e State troopers went car-to-car to provide supplies, ambulances sheltered some children in need of warmth, and tow trucks hauled vehicles out of the snow and ice. Meanwhile, truck drivers and other good Samaritans shared extra supplies. But it’s been a slow fix—way too slow for many. Virginia's governor rebuffed calls to deploy the national guard, saying that it wasn't required.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Virginia Department of Transportation told the NYT they expected to clear the interstate of stuck vehicles by end-of-day Tuesday. Virginia Senator Tim Kaine, for one, \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/timkaine/status/1478476547552169987?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e that he made it into Washington, DC, a mere 27 hours after he started his normally 2-hour trip from Richmond.—\u003cem\u003eJW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A worker delivers food in Xi'an\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/5c28e991d673496a3ac7a8d107729f599d62ee59-5184x3456.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNearly all of the 13 million residents in the Chinese city of Xi’an have \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-59864266?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeen quarantined\u003c/a\u003e in their homes since late December—and some have resorted to bartering due to shortages of food and supplies. A peek at how dire the situation is: One video circulating on Chinese social media shows a resident trading a Nintendo Switch for a packet of noodles and two buns.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow did Xi’an get here?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn late December, Xi’an households were forced to quarantine, but one family member was permitted to go on a grocery run every two days. The rules have since tightened: Now, residents must rely on government workers to provide daily necessities but have flocked to social media to complain they’re not getting enough.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eUnlike most other governments, China has followed a “zero Covid” strategy since the pandemic began, an approach in which it cuts off movement to and from any area that reports even a single case (think Wuhan in winter 2020). Xi’an has reported over 1,600 cases in the last two weeks.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Monday, a second large Chinese city, Yuzhou, was locked down after three cases were reported.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e China is frantically trying to contain Covid-19 ahead of the Beijing Winter Olympics and Lunar New Year; both are happening next month.—\u003cem\u003eJW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Eminem's Bored Ape Yacht Club NFT\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/23b64ed21de07fa05c9e69d94291858d6ef4549c-1240x744.webp?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eBored Ape Yacht Club\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Bored Ape Yacht Club (BAYC), a collection of 10,000 ape avatars that individually act as tickets to an online social club, has become one of the most prominent brands in the NFT space. And now, the NFTs have generated more than \u003ca href=\"https://www.theblockcrypto.com/linked/129084/bored-ape-yacht-club-crosses-1-billion-in-total-sales?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$1 billion in total sales\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou’ve likely seen a Bored Ape—like the botched restoration of the Jesus Christ fresco, they’re somewhat…unforgettable to look at. They’re also highly sought after: Eminem bought one for ~$462,000 on Dec. 31, joining the ranks of other celebrity buyers like Jimmy Fallon and Steph Curry.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut if you’re as bored of looking at the apes as they are of existing, you aren’t alone. Critics have called the BAYC project cynical, accusing it of being more about showcasing wealth than art. The current minimum cost for a BAYC NFT is about 70 ether, or around $266,000.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd then there’s the crime aspect: \u003c/strong\u003eThe NFT space has faced ridicule for its security issues, and the BAYC has had some notable recent thefts. One collector fell prey to a phishing scam and lost his collection, including many BAYC NFTs, worth $2.28 million. In a now-iconic tweet, he wrote, “I been hacked.
